definition: lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic

sentences.english: The oxygen radicals theory should be the etiology of presbyacusis.
sentences.chinese: 氧自由基學說可能是老年性聾的發病機制。

sentences.english: He is deaf of [in] one ear.
I cried, thinking him deaf, yet highly disgusted at his rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 我喊着，以爲他聾了，但是十分厭惡他的粗暴無禮。
到了1817年，他已經完全聾了。

sentences.english: But he seems to be deaf.
Methods To check on objective acoustic impedance and subjective pure tone audiometry.
sentences.chinese: 方法對外傷性聾進行客觀聲導抗測試和主觀純音測試。

sentences.english: AIM To explore the therapeutic effect of buflomedil hydrochloride injection on sudden deafness.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討鹽酸丁咯地爾治療突發性聾的療效。

sentences.english: Hellen Keller learned to speak; she was blind and deaf but not .
sentences.chinese: 海倫凱樂學習說話，她又聾又盲，但必不沉默。

sentences.english: The dog was 17 years old, deaf, blind and prone to “accidents”.
sentences.chinese: 這隻狗17歲了，又聾又瞎，隨時會掛掉似的。
正爲聾耳的阿伯拉罕吟唱。

sentences.english: They much prefer to join deaf and hard of hearing together into one category.
sentences.chinese: 他們大多喜歡把聾和重聽聯在一起作爲一個範疇。

sentences.english: Hearing parents can communicate with their deaf child.
sentences.chinese: 聽人父母可以和聾兒童用手語溝通。

sentences.english: Objective To study the effect of autotransfusion of ultraviolet irradiated blood (AUVIB) therapy on the sadden deafness.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討自血光量子療法綜合性治療突發性聾的療效。

sentences.english: Because she was deaf in one ear,she was hard of hearing.
sentences.chinese: 因爲她有一隻耳朵聾了，所以聽力不佳。

sentences.english: The child attitude is always, "Speak, Lord, for Thy servant heareth."
sentences.chinese: 於是我向神就是聾了耳，沒有孩子的樣式。

sentences.english: Early interventions are of great importance to children with congenital sensorineural deafness.
sentences.chinese: 兒童先天性感音神經性聾的早期干預非常重要。

definition: to reject/to expel/to discard/to exclude/to renounce
(onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
to slander/to defame/to speak ill of
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
rich/abundant/exuberant/to add for free/to throw in as bonus/to spare/to forgive/despite/although
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
